channel.title: problem with whonix gateway and debian
channel.description:
Hello
I would like to know what configuration is valid to put on the vm of whonix gateway and debian
When I install the vm and i choose reload tor I get this:
You configured a non-loopback address '10.152.152.10:9179' for SocksPort. This allows everybody on your local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted
i searched this non-issue and this is the explanation
This is not of concern. Tor really listens on that IP/port. **It is Whonix-Gateway's network interface, that is only available to Whonix-Workstations**, because it is an internal network with Whonix-Workstation and because Whonix-Gateway is firewalled
so i'm wondering if i should to put another nameserver in debian ...
thank you so much

item.title: problem with whonix gateway and debian
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
y010:

so i’m wondering if i should to put another nameserver in debian …

Whonix

Other Operating Systems

Anonymize any Operating System! Your operating system tunneled through the Tor Anonymity Network! Create your Custom-Whonix-Workstation!

That page contains instructions for that.

Read full topic
item.source: problem with whonix gateway and debian

item.title: problem with whonix gateway and debian
item.dc:creator: y010
item.description:
Hello

I would like to know what configuration is valid to put on the vm of whonix gateway and debian

When I install the vm and i choose reload tor I get this:

You configured a non-loopback address ‘10.152.152.10:9179’ for SocksPort. This allows everybody on your local network to use your machine as a proxy. Make sure this is what you wanted

i searched this non-issue and this is the explanation

This is not of concern. Tor really listens on that IP/port. It is Whonix-Gateway’s network interface, that is only available to Whonix-Workstations, because it is an internal network with Whonix-Workstation and because Whonix-Gateway is firewalled

so i’m wondering if i should to put another nameserver in debian …

thank you so much
